intro: Stilpnopappus regnellii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with gray-green, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures that aid in wind dispersal. Its root system is extensive and deep, allowing it to access groundwater in dry soils. Stilpnopappus regnellii is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
